All Derby Public Schools students and staff will receive this water bottle provided to them. All district drinking fountains are shut off/not available for use unless the fountain has a bottle filler. Students and staff will be encouraged to bring their own personal water bottle or use this refillable water bottle provided. It was approved at the August 3 Board of Education meeting to purchase bottle fillers for the district from Grainger, a vendor on the Greenbush COOP purchasing agreement as part of the district‚Äôs safety plan. The high school already has bottle fillers as part of the bond projects, so this purchase was for the elementary and middle schools. The goal has been to prioritize buildings that have no bottle fillers currently so they can start the school year.

Water bottles and bottle fillers were purchased through CARES funding. We are appreciative of this funding received to support a variety of COVID-19 related safety precautions in our district!

Oaklawn Elementary recently learned they're a top 10 school for their fundraising for Pennies for Patients. Every year The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society - Mid-America Chapter recognizes schools that achieve milestones in their Pennies for Patients campaign. Oaklawn earned a Top 10 School award, which is recognition for the highest fundraising schools in the Mid-America Chapter. This past year, they raised $5,056.28, and were the 3rd highest fundraising school! Their contributions help fund critical research and provide financial support and resources to local blood cancer patients. They will receive a physical award from LLS, to recognize this outstanding achievement in the Fall sometime.

Way to go, Oaklawn! We are #DerbyProud.

Derby Middle School Bulldog Makeover and House Construction

It was truly an honor to be asked to work on this project with such historical value to Derby Middle School!

The bulldog statue has lived alone in the display case for a number of years until the DMS PAMS-PTO commissioned for the statue to be repainted and have a house built to fill the case.

The statue is painted to be 3D version of the school logo using the same color scheme for the body, mimicking the same facial features including the shape of the eyes, shading on the face and even the number of spots on each side of the face.

The house was constructed using actual floor planks from the original gym floor, customized to size for the case. As well, the case is lined with turf from the football field bringing in many different elements to create this amazing display!

A very special thanks to the members of Derby Middle School PAMS for the opportunity to be a part of this project, and to Derby Middle School and Derby Public Schools for the chance to add to the history of the building!
